market.englishIntro: Let's learn how to say 'I want tomatoes and potatoes' in Hindi.
market.englishMeaning: This is how you politely ask for vegetables at the market.

market.englishIntro: Here's how to ask 'How much is this?' - super useful at any market!
market.englishMeaning: Use this to ask the price of anything.

market.englishIntro: Want to bargain politely? Try this phrase:
market.englishMeaning: This means 'Please reduce the price a little' - very polite!

market.englishIntro: To check if vegetables are fresh, ask:
market.englishMeaning: This means 'Is this fresh?' - important for good vegetables!

market.englishIntro: When you want exactly one kilo, say:
market.englishMeaning: This means 'Please give me one kilo' - very useful!

taxi.englishIntro: First thing to tell a taxi driver - where you want to go:
taxi.englishMeaning: This means 'I need to go to the market.'

taxi.englishIntro: Always ask about the fare upfront:
taxi.englishMeaning: This means 'How much will it cost?' - very important!

taxi.englishIntro: If the driver is going too fast, politely say:
taxi.englishMeaning: This means 'Please drive a little slowly' - for safety!

taxi.englishIntro: To ask if they'll use the meter:
taxi.englishMeaning: This means 'Will you go by the meter?' - helps avoid overcharging.

rickshaw.englishIntro: To ask a rickshaw driver if they'll take you somewhere:
rickshaw.englishMeaning: This means 'Will you go to the station?' - replace 'station' with your destination.
This means 'Is fifty rupees okay?' - adjust the amount as needed.

rickshaw.englishIntro: To ask for a small discount:
rickshaw.englishMeaning: This means 'Please reduce a little' - polite bargaining.
This means 'How long will it take?' - good for planning.

neighbor.englishMeaning: This means 'Hello, I'm Emily' - perfect for meeting neighbors!
This means 'This is my daughter, Sophia.'

neighbor.englishIntro: A polite way to say you enjoyed meeting someone:
neighbor.englishMeaning: This means 'Nice to meet you' - very polite and warm!

neighbor.englishIntro: To ask how long someone has lived somewhere:
neighbor.hindiPhrase: आप यहाँ कब से रहते हैं?
neighbor.englishMeaning: This means 'Since when have you been living here?' - good conversation starter.
neighbor.pronunciation: Aap yahan kab se rehte hain?

neighbor.englishIntro: A lovely way to invite someone for tea:
neighbor.englishMeaning: This means 'Please come for tea' - very Indian hospitality!

introductions.hindiPhrase: हम यहाँ छह महीने रहते हैं।
introductions.englishMeaning: This means 'We live here for six months.'
introductions.pronunciation: Hum yahan chhe mahine rehte hain

introductions.englishMeaning: This means 'Shall we meet tomorrow?' - friendly and casual.
This means 'This is my husband, Jonathan.'

introductions.englishIntro: The classic question to ask someone's name:
introductions.englishMeaning: This means 'What is your name?' - essential for introductions!

church.englishIntro: A beautiful Christian greeting in Hindi:
church.englishMeaning: This means 'May you find peace in Jesus' - very meaningful!

church.englishIntro: Respectful way to greet an elder at church:
church.englishMeaning: This means 'How are you, Aunty?' - shows proper respect.

church.englishIntro: To thank someone for praying for you:
church.englishMeaning: This means 'Thank you for the prayer' - very heartfelt.

church.englishIntro: A blessing you can give to others:
church.englishMeaning: This means 'May the Lord bless you' - beautiful blessing!

church.hindiPhrase: आज का संदेश बहुत अच्छा था।
church.englishMeaning: This means 'Today's message was very good' - shows you were listening!
church.pronunciation: Aaj ka sandesh bahut accha tha
